artist: Artist: Katsukawa Shun'ei; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: Censor seal: 極 {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: {Eijudō}; date seal: 弐
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: An imposing, six-foot-tall competitor inside the ring, Tamagaki Gakunosuke (1768–1813) appears very relaxed here in a loosely tied robe, smoking a pipe. He changed his name several times over his career as a wrestler. This portrait was released at the time of the tournament in the second month of 1806, when he began to use the name Tamagaki Gakunosuke.
title: The Sumo Wrestler Tamagaki Gakunosuke
